it.unica.foresee.core
Class Interpreter

java.lang.Object
  it.unica.foresee.core.Interpreter
Deprecated. 

Class to parse the instructions of the program.

This class represents a simple parser for the instructions of the framework. It can be invoked to execute an instruction file or to take commands from an interactive shell.

The syntax of an accepted command is the following one:

command [args]

  • `command` a command accepted by `CommandList`
  • `[args]` a variable number of arguments

The arguments can be written literally or between quotes. The former is the standard for the options of the commands, while the latter is useful for parameters which can contain whitespaces.

For a list of the standard accepted commands see FSCommandList .

For a list of the legacy, "ART", accepted commands see ARTCommandList .

 

public class Interpreter
extends java.lang.Object

CHECK_STRING_START

public final java.util.regex.Pattern CHECK_STRING_START
Deprecated. 

Pattern to check if there's any double quotes in the string.

Regex: p{javaWhitespace}*".*

CHECK_STRING_MATCHING_DELIMITERS

public final java.util.regex.Pattern CHECK_STRING_MATCHING_DELIMITERS
Deprecated. 

Pattern to check if there are matching double quotes, in the string.

Skips escaped quotes (i.e. \") and allows to escape escape characters (i.e. \).

Regex: p{javaWhitespace}*".*(?&lt;!(?&lt;!\\)\\)"

FIND_WHOLE_STRING

public final java.util.regex.Pattern FIND_WHOLE_STRING
Deprecated. 

Pattern to find pieces of strings surrounded by quotes.

Skips escaped quotes (i.e. \") and allows to escape escape characters (i.e. \).

Regex: p{javaWhitespace}*"((?&lt;!\\)(\\")|[^")])*(?&lt;!(?&lt;!\\)\\)"

Meaning: take whitespaces, followed by quotes, followed by some characters (even 0) followed by quotes. The characters can be any caracter except the " symbol except when escaped with a . The \ is an escape symbol, except if it escaped with another \ (i.e. to mean \ write \). The closing quotes cannot be preceded by a \, except if even that \ is escaped (i.e. "\" is ok).

workdir

protected java.lang.String workdir(java.lang.String path)
Deprecated. 

Helper function to use the current work directory.

If you need a path to be in the work directory, just use workdir(path) to retrieve the path relative to the work directory.

Parameters:
path - the path to a file or folder
Returns:
a path relative to the current work directory
